abstract: First Data  is near a deal to be sold for nearly $27 billion to the private equity firm Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Company.
snippet: First Data  is near a deal to be sold for nearly $27 billion to the private equity firm Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Company.
lead_paragraph: First Data, one of the nation’s largest credit-card processing companies, is near a deal to be sold for nearly $27 billion to the private equity firm Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Company, according to people involved in the transaction. The deal for First Data, which controls the NYCE payment network, is expected to be announced tomorrow morning.

headline.main: Kohlberg Kravis Nears Deal to Buy First Data

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Michael J. de la Merced
